body:
Currently if ScheduleToClose timeout is not specified both ScheduleToStart and StartToClose are required. For the majority of use cases defaulting ScheduleToStart to the workflow execution timeout is the right thing to do. 

So the issue is to make ScheduleToStart optional and default it to the workflow execution timeout. So only one of ScheduleToClose or StartToClose timeouts should be required.
title: Make ScheduleToStart timeout optional
